subject: Tax
title: CIR vs. Algue, Inc. (G.R. No. L-28896)
ratio: Taxes are the lifeblood of the government and their prompt and certain availability is an imperious need.

subject: Tax
title: Lutz vs. Araneta (98 Phil. 148)
ratio: Taxation may be used for implementation of the State's police power; the Sugar Adjustment Act was valid to protect the sugar industry.

subject: Tax
title: Pascual vs. Secretary of Public Works (110 Phil. 331)
ratio: Tax revenues must only be used for public purposes. Appropriation for private roads is unconstitutional.

subject: Taxation
title: Commissioner vs. Court of Appeals (G.R. No. 115349)
ratio: The Power to Tax includes the power to destroy if used as an implement of police power, but if used solely for revenue, it must not be confiscatory.
mnemonic: Tax: Power to Destroy vs. Revenue

subject: Taxation
title: Abakada Gura vs. Ermita (G.R. No. 168056)
ratio: The delegation of the power to increase the VAT rate to the President is not an unconstitutional delegation of legislative power, as the President acts only as an agent of Congress under specific conditions.

subject: Taxation
title: Doctrine of Equitable Recoupment
ratio: This doctrine is NOT allowed in the Philippines. A taxpayer cannot offset a tax refund with a tax liability if the claims arise from different taxes or periods.
